content: & continue to stuff as you go r27 *single_crochet in first 3 sts decrease single_crochet in next 4 sts * repeat around 48 r28 *single_crochet in first 6 sts decrease * repeat around 42 r29 *single_crochet in first 2 sts decrease single_crochet in next 3 sts * repeat around 36 r30 *single_crochet in first 4 sts decrease * repeat around 30 r31 *single_crochet in first st decrease single_crochet in next 2 sts * repeat around 24 r32 *single_crochet in first 2 sts decrease * repeat around 18 r33 *decrease single_crochet in next st * repeat around 12 r34 decrease around 6 fasten_off use the tail of your yarn to sew the top of your crewmate s head closed visor with 2 strands of color b chain 9 r1 working in the top loop of your chain single_crochet in 2nd st from hook and in next 6 sts 4 single_crochet in the last st rotate your work upside down to continue working in the bottom loops of your chain single_crochet in next 6 sts 3 single_crochet in last st 20 r2 increase in first st single_crochet in the next 6 sts increase in the next 4 sts single_crochet in the next 6 sts increase in the last 3 sts 28 r3 single_crochet in first st increase in the next st single_crochet in next 6 sts single_crochet increase 4 times single_crochet in the next 6 sts single_crochet increase 3 times 36 ​ ​ ​ ​ r4 increase in first st single_crochet in next 8 sts increase single_crochet single_crochet 4 times single_crochet in the next 6 sts increase single_crochet single_crochet 3 times 44 ​ ​ ​ ​ r5 single_crochet in first 4 sts decrease single_crochet in next 4 sts decrease single_crochet in next 14 sts decrease single_crochet in next 4 sts decrease single_crochet in last 10 sts 40 r6 single_crochet around 40 change to color c 2 strands fasten_off color b r7 slip_stitch in blo around 40 fasten_off leave a long tail for sewing backpack three options are included option 1 will leave your backpack pocket open on top option 2 will give your backpack a button-close flap option 3 will have you repeat the base rounds of the backpack and sew it to the top to create a fully closed pack no pocket all three backpack options follow the same instructions through round 13 with 2 strands of color a chain 16 r1 working in the top loop of your chain single_crochet in 2nd st from hook and in next 13 sts 3 single_crochet in the last st rotate your work upside down to continue working in the bottom loops of your chain single_crochet in next 13 sts 2 single_crochet in last st slip_stitch to first single_crochet 32 r2 chain 1 increase in first st single_crochet in the next 13 sts increase single_crochet increase single_crochet in the next 13 sts increase single_crochet increase slip_stitch to first single_crochet 36 r3 chain 1 in blo single_crochet around slip_stitch to first single_crochet 36 r4-r13 chain
